steps.title: Make sure the Kindle Fire is fully charged.
steps.content: Make sure the Kindle Fire is fully charged. To charge your Kindle fire, simply connect your charger to a power outlet, and then connect the other end to your Kindle Fire.

steps.title: Connect to a Wi-Fi connection.
steps.content: Connect to a Wi-Fi connection. A connection is required to update software. Tap on the "Settings" icon at the top-right corner of the home screen.

steps.title: Select Wi-Fi.
steps.content: Select Wi-Fi. Toggle the Wireless Network switch on. A window where all networks available will appear.

steps.title: Select the name of the network you are going to use.
steps.content: Select the name of the network you are going to use. Enter password of the network if required. If no password is required, you'll be automatically connected to the Internet.

steps.title: Head to "Settings.
steps.content: Head to "Settings. " Tap on the "Settings" icon at the top-right corner of the home screen.

steps.title: Select "Sync.
steps.content: Select "Sync. " Any updates will be automatically downloaded in the background. Once download is complete, the update will be automatically applied. You can also update your Kindle Fire manually, see the following steps to do so.

steps.title: Visit the software updates website.
steps.content: Visit the software updates website. Navigate to https://www.amazon.com/gp/help/customer/display.html?nodeId=200790620 .

steps.title: Download your software.
steps.content: Download your software. Locate the download link and click on it. Follow the prompts to fully download the software.

steps.title: Connect your Kindle Fire to your computer.
steps.content: Connect your Kindle Fire to your computer. Make sure your Kindle Fire is on and unlocked. Use a USB cable - the one that came with it - to plug the device into your computer.

steps.title: Transfer the software update.
steps.content: Transfer the software update. Open the Kindle Fire drive, titled Kindle. Locate the software update file, and drag and drop it into the kindleupdates folder.

steps.title: Disconnect your Kindle Fire.
steps.content: Disconnect your Kindle Fire. Once the transfer is complete, tap Disconnect on the screen of your Kindle Fire. You can now disconnect the USB cable from your device.

steps.title: Update your kindle.
steps.content: Update your kindle. Navigate to Quick Settings and tap More. Tap on Device, then tap on Update Your Kindle. Let the software update run its course.
